alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 3:56AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 AM EST, the river gage at on Middle Island Creek near Little was at 17.59 feet, and indicates moderate flooding is occurring due to runoff from earlier rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Arvilla and Point Lookout. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
